rev.comment: Reverted to revision 458637593 by Chris the speller: most of this is actually confusion - can we all stop twiddling with the introduction and work on the actual article?. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
overview: trying to tweak and update
/* Pathophysiology */[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]] per [[WP:HYPHEN]], sub-subsection 3, points 3,4,5, replaced: self destruct â self-destruct using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7852)
fixed awful ungrammatical sentence - cancer doesn't form tumours
Clarifying role of oncogenes and tumour suppressors in opening section - they are not only "inherited"
It's normally impossible; it's only in statistics that we can find causes

I'd hate to call this dumbing it down, but honestly the intro is far too technical. Attempting a bold rewrite. I'm not a medical professional, which might not be a bad thing for writing, but check it.
rm "blanket term" (doesn't add anything), we don't need sources for everything in the intro so removing "citation needed", trim Google Books URL
More changes made to the opening section
I have added clarifying information to the opening paragraphs
As discussed in the talk page, I have made some changes to the opening paragraph to make it a bit more 'plain English'. I have also added a bit to the "cause" section
Robot - Removing category Article Feedback Pilot per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2011 September 15]].
/* Signs and symptoms */ Dropping a bit of jargon. Also replacing "patient."
Various citation & identifier cleanup, plus AWB genfixes. using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Further reading */ Just because the URL stops working doesn't mean that the book stops existing
/* Further reading */ normalized citation to pazdur
/* Further reading */ normalized citation style for tannock
/* Further reading */ normalized citation style for kleinsmith.
/* Further reading */ added mukherjee's history of cancer.

/* References */ /* References */ changed name of section to "further reading", as only a couple of these are actually used as references, and most of the references are not listed here, but in the "notes" section.
/* References */ added dead link template to encyclopedia of cancer
/* Prevention */ changed "incedence" to "risk" to accurately reflect the given link (first sentence)
/* Signs and symptoms */ Rm tag: this is common knowledge
/* Causes */ Restore concept from the first sentence, with an example
Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Bill545|Bill545]] ([[User talk:Bill545|talk]]): Better before. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Causes */ minor HTML ("look n feel") tweak

deleted duplicate "causes" section near top as it has its own section; added info from N.C.I. on causes. Also clarified/correct where it says "environmental" to say add "lifestyle," which was left out of the quoted source and so is misleading.
/* Research */ Added Cancer Research UK to the list of organisations - it is the largest independent cancer research organisation in Europe, funding 4,000 researchers
removed [[Category:Types of cancer]]; added [[Category:Types of neoplasia]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
Reverted to revision 441263285 by David Eppstein: previous character was better. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Classification */ Rv: These are ordered by relative frequency, so that the reader encounters the most 'important' forms first
/* Classification */ changed spindle cell "carninma" [sic] to "spindle cell sarcinoma"
/* Classification */ fixed red links in the last paragraph
/* Classification */ alphabetized lists, made mechanics corrections
inserted missing word, changed where to the more appropriate wherein
[364]Add: series, isbn, doi_inactivedate. Tweak: isbn, doi.
agree that [[medical imaging]] is a better link for this
Reverted to revision 435448522 by Gwendal: strikeout in the lead of a major article? don't be daft. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
dx is by medical radiography (i.e. by routine X-ray, MRI, sonogram), biopsy is not always necessary for dx: leukemia can be diagnosed by a drop of blood on a slide
breast cancer often presents as asymptomatic lump, plasma cell myeloma can be suspected by blood or urine test
/* Heredity */ rejig section structure for flow, removed MEN as it does not usually cause cancer (it causes benign hormally active adenomas)
/* Society and culture */ "Now" means "today, and any day for the last two decades, and probably any day for the next two decades"
/* Society and culture */ "Now" means "any time since shortly after the date given in the previous sentence"
Reverted to revision 429665211 by Citation bot; not notable in its own right. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Reverted to revision 428752268 by Lotje; that doesn't sound quite right. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Management */ "Now", meaning "at any point in time, the experimental treatments are the ones being studied at that time"
/* Management */ Wikipedia uses [[WP:MSH|sentence case]] for section headings
/* History */ remove historical claim cited to dubious alternative medicine source added by a user with a history of citation problems - see [[Wikipedia:Jagged_85_cleanup]]
/* Chemicals */ added numbers and removed unreffed pathophysio from wrong section
[344]+: doi, issue, editor1-last, editor1-first, title, volume, pages. Formatted [[WP:ENDASH|dashes]].
Dated {{When}} x 8{{Unreferenced section}} x 2{{Citation needed}} x 2. (Build p609)
Move paragraph (more about prognosis than epidemiology, I think)
/* Radiation */ Clarify role of non-ionizing radiation

Undid revision 424232475 by [[Special:Contributions/Oni Ookami Alfador|Oni Ookami Alfador]] ([[User talk:Oni Ookami Alfador|talk]]) Rv error: Ultraviolet radiation (UVB) is NON-ionizing and causes more cancer than anything else

/* Radiation */ removing the conflicting insistence t hat non-ionizing radiation causes cancer. The vast majority of sources indicate that this is either not true or inconclusive per the last paragraph in the section.
/* Pathophysiology */ this sees to be a better place
/* Signs and symptoms */ this is the wrong place for that reference - it discusses the biological properties of cancer cells, not the signs and symptoms
/* Hormones */ There's no "may" or "might" about this fact
/* Society and culture */ added some links
/* Society and culture */ metaphysically? not really necessary and creates more confusion than it resolves
fixed sister project link for Wikinews
adding Article Feedback category for pilot project
Undid revision 419244620 by [[Special:Contributions/Andycjp|Andycjp]] ([[User talk:Andycjp|talk]]) What links? and add chapter names
/* Physical agents */ technically 6 minerals and we list non-asbestos (although related) causes
Reverted to revision 418326024 by WhatamIdoing; this is more than a link. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Physical agents */ corrected for scientific accuracy
/* Physical agents */ corrected for scientific accuracy
/* Signs and symptoms */ changed defintition of anemia from "low blood count" to "low red blood cell count
/* Epidemiology */ Development of cancer is not the same as diagnosis of cancer
/* Epidemiology */ Overdiagnosis: On two almost inevitable cancers
/* Epidemiology */ Old age is the primary risk factor
Added paragraph about new theory as to the origin of cancer that contrasts with the internal Darwinism model already mentioned.
will try to find global data
moved US specific data to subpage
The NYTs is not a suitable source
ref does not stipulate in the USA
removed a bunch of sources that fail [[WP:MEDMOS]]
moved to section in which it is discussed
/* Physical agents */ Split: Heat is not a "physical agent", and the role of inflammation is a big deal in current research.
Undid revision 412502983 by [[Special:Contributions/Jmh649|Jmh649]] All cancers are "genetic" (mutations); only some have an inherited genetic component
rv, the source is clear that these beliefs are incorrect
who cares what the chemical name is...
that is not what the ref syas
restored what the ref says, it does not mention age
Again, a minor tweak to try and remove overly conclusive and contradictory wording. Environment can't "enhance" a genetic abnormality (e.g. a proto-oncogene) if environment only affects non -genetic.
Per talk page, proposing a word change to address the concern. I think the broader idea that "environmental is not everything" is accounted for in the following sentence.
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/BalanceInAction|BalanceInAction]] ([[User talk:BalanceInAction|talk]]) to last version by WhatamIdoing
Bot: fixing section wikilinks and minor changes
/* Physical trauma and inflammation */ New section
/* Genetic testing */ {{See also}} link to [[Cancer syndrome]]
/* Society and culture */ Skin cancer isn't "real" cancer
Reverted to revision 408738537 by Jmh649; leave it general in the lead. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Here too. By the way, this info is presented three times in the article.
"ionizing radiation" is what is meant here
do not revert without justification - Jmh649 correctly states that ANY form of radiation is carcinogenic - why are you using this specific example (in addition to, say, medical exposure)?

/* Causes */ [[radiological contamination]] is distinct from radiation, especially when secondary sources are involved, as in Chernobyl to cow milk in Scandanavia
Disambiguated: [[spine]] â [[Vertebral column]], [[genetic]] â [[Heredity]], [[Alexander Monro]] â [[Alexander Monro (primus)]] using [[tools:~dispenser/view/Dab_solver|Dab solver]]
/* Prognosis */ Relationship to quality of life
/* Society and culture */ Expand and source; move prognosis to correct section
Just cancer, not Cancer Cancer - Fixed ref
clean up, typos fixed: occuring â occurring, is is â it is, aquired â acquired using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Infection */ remove polyoma virus (likely but not established), add parasites, reduce overlinking
rewrote deaths per year section of intro
moved a paragraph about cancer research from pathogenesis to research subheading.
/* Pathophysiology */ I've cut this down, copy-edited, and re-ordered for clarity.
Pathophysiology moved above Causes... understanding path makes a more logical exploration of causes possible.
/* Signs and symptoms */ mostly copy-editing, but I think this needs to be inclusive rather than exhaustive.
edit photo caption for ambiguity ("lung sac") and link targets
/* Classification */ added links and edited for clarity and accuracy.
/* Society and culture */ rewrote section - there is research in this area, but I have limited command of it - the two things mentioned currently are verifiable and not disputed
The american society link was not for 2004 and did not include the percentage of deaths worldwide
Began cleanup of opening paragraphs, added some internal links.
/* History */ moved historical poster re. cancer treatment into history section.
/* Management */ removed potentially misleading historical treatment poster, to reinstate in history section of article.
moved to talk, should be combined into text
fixed, radon causes cancer via radiation
discusses both ionizing and non ionizing
removed the stating of the obvious
if these are important combine them into the article
/* Management */ historical image: not sure if better here or in history section
/* Infection */ H pylori is not a virus

rm another stale tag - individual sections should be tagged rather than the entire article
rv claims for alternative modality that are not widely recognised as beneficial - please discuss on talk before contemplating reinsertion
